items.content_html: Sending a fax like it’s 1998, only on the internet because it’s 2018. Why do fraud places that handle “sensitive information” think that this is still a secure way to send data?

I learned today that iCloud syncs iPhone call histories. I’ve got a work phone that’s been buzzing with pages all week, and those calls are on my personal phone’s history. Crazy. And there’s no way to disable that sync as far as I can tell.
Ugh. Dealing with identity theft that you thought you’d taken care of years ago is the worst.
I’ve really been enjoying The Omni Show, and am looking forward to listening to this week’s episode with Ken Case. Thanks Omni!
This seems to aptly sum up my week thus far.
Been getting into making Old Fashions lately. This one turned out quite nicely.

I see lots of people talking about the “Snow Leopard” releases of iOS and macOS as meaning focusing on quality. But Snow Leopard also had a 2 year lifecycle and spanned 10.6.0-10.6.8. Will those days of 2 years between major OS releases come back?

I really like this post from Manton Reece about how he’s setting up micro.blog. I took analytics off my site (which were meager at best) because after posting something, I’d check the dashboard regularly. I don’t want to be writing for the (nonexistent) numbers anymore.
I know portrait mode isn’t perfect, but it can be pretty darn good.
There’s an irony to keeping my LastPass password and OTP token inside 1Password.
